sections.heading: What is Ta-form?
sections.content:
た-form (ta-form) is the plain/casual past tense . It expresses completed actions in informal speech.

食べた (tabeta) - ate 行った (itta) - went した (shita) - did

sections.heading: Ta-form vs Te-form
sections.content:
Key relationship: Ta-form is made from te-form!

て → た (te → ta) で → だ (de → da) 食べて → 食べた 読んで → 読んだ

Just change the final vowel: e → a

children.heading: From Te-form to Ta-form
children.content:
Simple rule: Change て to た, で to だ

Te-form → Ta-form 食べて → 食べた 飲んで → 飲んだ 書いて → 書いた

children.heading: Ichidan Verbs
children.content:
Drop る , add た :

食べる → 食べた (ate) 見る → 見た (saw) 寝る → 寝た (slept) 起きる → 起きた (woke up) 教える → 教えた (taught) 着る → 着た (wore)

children.heading: Irregular Verbs
children.content: する → した (did) 来る → 来た (came)

children.heading: Godan Verbs
children.content: Follow the same patterns as te-form, but with た/だ:

children.heading: Pattern 1: う, つ, る → った
children.content: 買う → 買った (bought) 待つ → 待った (waited) 帰る → 帰った (returned)

children.heading: Pattern 2: む, ぶ, ぬ → んだ
children.content: 読む → 読んだ (read) 遊ぶ → 遊んだ (played) 死ぬ → 死んだ (died)

children.heading: Pattern 3: く → いた
children.content:
書く → 書いた (wrote) 聞く → 聞いた (listened) 歩く → 歩いた (walked)

Exception: 行く → 行った (iku → itta)

children.heading: Pattern 4: ぐ → いだ
children.content: 泳ぐ → 泳いだ (swam) 急ぐ → 急いだ (hurried)

children.heading: Pattern 5: す → した
children.content: 話す → 話した (spoke) 貸す → 貸した (lent)

sections.heading: Complete Conjugation Chart
sections.content: | Dictionary | Te-form | Ta-form | Meaning | | ---------- | ------- | ------- | -------- | | 食べる | 食べて | 食べた | ate | | 見る | 見て | 見た | saw | | 買う | 買って | 買った | bought | | 待つ | 待って | 待った | waited | | 帰る | 帰って | 帰った | returned | | 読む | 読んで | 読んだ | read | | 遊ぶ | 遊んで | 遊んだ | played | | 死ぬ | 死んで | 死んだ | died | | 書く | 書いて | 書いた | wrote | | 泳ぐ | 泳いで | 泳いだ | swam | | 話す | 話して | 話した | spoke | | 行く | 行って | 行った | went | | する | して | した | did | | 来る | 来て | 来た | came |

children.heading: 1. Casual Past Statements
children.content:
With friends, family, casual situations:

昨日映画見た "I watched a movie yesterday" 今朝パン食べた "I ate bread this morning" さっき友達に会った "I met a friend just now"

children.heading: 2. Confirming Events
children.content: もう食べた？ "Did you already eat?" 宿題した？ "Did you do homework?" 行った？ "Did you go?"

children.heading: 3. Narrative/Story
children.content: 昔々、ある所におじいさんとおばあさんが住んでいた "Long ago, an old man and woman lived..."

children.heading: 4. Grammar Patterns
children.content:
Many patterns require ta-form:

食べたことがある - have eaten (experience) 見たことがない - have never seen 行ったほうがいい - should go

sections.heading: Polite vs Plain Past
sections.content:
| Plain (Ta-form) | Polite (Mashita) | Meaning | | --------------- | ---------------- | ------- | | 食べた | 食べました | ate | | 行った | 行きました | went | | した | しました | did | | 来た | 来ました | came | | 見た | 見ました | saw |

Use ta-form with friends, mashita with others!

sections.heading: Question Form
sections.content:
Use rising intonation or add の:

もう食べた？ "Did you eat already?" 昨日どこ行った？ "Where did you go yesterday?" 映画見たの？ "Did you watch the movie?"

children.heading: Asking About Past
children.content: 週末何した？ "What did you do on the weekend?" 昨日誰と会った？ "Who did you meet yesterday?" どこで買った？ "Where did you buy it?"

children.heading: Answering
children.content: Q: 映画見た？ A: うん、見た "Yeah, I saw it" Q: 宿題した？ A: ううん、まだ "Nope, not yet"

sections.heading: Experience Pattern (～たことがある)
sections.content: 日本に行ったことがある "I have been to Japan" 納豆を食べたことがある？ "Have you ever eaten natto?" 富士山を見たことがない "I've never seen Mt. Fuji"

sections.heading: Should/Better to (～たほうがいい)
sections.content: 早く寝たほうがいい "You should sleep early" 医者に行ったほうがいい "You should go to the doctor" 勉強したほうがいいよ "You'd better study"

sections.heading: Just Did (～たばかり)
sections.content: 今起きたばかり "I just woke up" さっき食べたばかり "I just ate" 昨日買ったばかり "I just bought it yesterday"

sections.heading: After Doing (～た後で)
sections.content: 食べた後で歯を磨く "I brush my teeth after eating" 宿題をした後で遊ぶ "I play after doing homework"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using Ta-form in Formal Situations
children.content: Wrong: 先生、昨日行った ❌ Right: 先生、昨日行きました ✓

children.heading: Mistake 2: Wrong て → た Conversion
children.content: Wrong: 飲んで → 飲んた ❌ Right: 飲んで → 飲んだ ✓ Wrong: 書いて → 書いだ ❌ Right: 書いて → 書いた ✓

children.heading: Mistake 3: Forgetting 行く Exception
children.content: Wrong: 行いた ❌ Right: 行った ✓

children.heading: Mistake 4: Wrong Godan Pattern
children.content: Wrong: 買う → 買うた ❌ Right: 買う → 買った ✓ Wrong: 読む → 読むた ❌ Right: 読む → 読んだ ✓

children.heading: Simple Past
children.content: 昨日公園で遊んだ "I played in the park yesterday" 今朝早く起きた "I woke up early this morning" 先週友達に会った "I met a friend last week"

children.heading: With Time Expressions
children.content: 3時間前に食べた "I ate 3 hours ago" 去年日本に行った "I went to Japan last year" 5分前に来た "I came 5 minutes ago"

children.heading: Describing Past States
children.content: 昨日は暑かった "It was hot yesterday" その映画は面白かった "That movie was interesting" 子供の時は背が低かった "I was short when I was a child"

children.heading: Example 1: After School
children.content: A: 今日学校どうだった？ "How was school today?" B: 楽しかった！新しい友達できた "It was fun! I made a new friend" A: いいね！どこの人？ "Nice! Where are they from?" B: 大阪から来た "They came from Osaka"

children.heading: Example 2: Weekend Chat
children.content: A: 週末何した？ "What did you do on the weekend?" B: 映画見て、買い物した "I watched a movie and went shopping" A: 何買った？ "What did you buy?" B: 服買った "I bought clothes"

children.heading: Example 3: Food Talk
children.content: A: もう昼ご飯食べた？ "Did you eat lunch already?" B: うん、さっき食べた "Yeah, I just ate" A: 何食べた？ "What did you eat?" B: ラーメン食べた "I ate ramen"

sections.heading: Building Narratives
sections.content: 今朝早く起きた。 朝ご飯を食べた。 それから学校に行った。 友達に会った。 一緒に勉強した。 楽しかった。 "I woke up early this morning. I ate breakfast. Then I went to school. I met friends. We studied together. It was fun."

sections.heading: Negative Ta-form
sections.content:
Use なかった :

食べた → 食べなかった (didn't eat) 行った → 行かなかった (didn't go) した → しなかった (didn't do)

More details in Nakatta Form lesson.

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ Ta-form = plain/casual past tense ✓ Made from te-form: て → た, で → だ ✓ Same patterns as te-form ✓ Used in casual speech ✓ Essential for grammar patterns ✓ Exception: 行く → 行った ✓ Remember: polite situations need ました

Master ta-form - essential for casual past tense!

Next: Nai-form (Plain Negative)

Related:

Te-form Conjugation Mashita Form (Polite Past) Nakatta Form (Past Negative)
